{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3689669,"name":"","username":"w1zxrd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/w1zxrd/{size}/246745_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T04:02:08.174Z","cooked":"

I’m curious if any FRC teams have experimented with or implemented systems where their robot observes other robots’ positions to help with navigation or strategy.

I’ve been thinking about applying more advanced control policies to FRC lately as an academic curiosity - RL, MPC, etc.

Especially for RL, I see simulating alliance/opponent movements as useful for modeling the reward function or changing the constraints for MPC.

In terms of actually observing the relative ground truths, I think this could be achieved by using a color camera(s) on the robot to observe bumpers - they’re relatively distinct, and you can distinguish between opposition or alliance.

For training RL, maybe extracting data from AScope recorded trajectories from team repos, or building some type of model to extract poses from real footage? (seems far too time-consuming to be practical, but then again, who’s actually using this for high school robotics anyways)

Anyways, just wondering if anyone has attempted this (the robot observation side, or the modeling side)

haven’t attempted this but it has also been annoyingly stuck in my head and won’t go away as something i want to do. I had thought about using depth cameras paired with color cameras to do something similar or running a depth model like the nvidia one that released a few months ago to try and detect moving robot shaped blobs

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T04:18:28.026Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":282,"readers_count":281,"score":120.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"kieran","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3689691,"name":"","username":"w1zxrd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/w1zxrd/{size}/246745_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T04:39:29.007Z","cooked":"

that’s interesting- a stereo camera or even a lidar puck could definitely help though i feel like it might be cost prohibitive… also a lidar would be difficult to position effectively on a robot, too high and it won’t catch anything- but too low, and it’ll be obstructed by the robot itself.

through the lab i intern at, i have access to veo 3 and the latest nvidia models plus enough compute for training and processing… i’ll see if i can run some tests soon. veo 3 probably won’t have fast enough realtime processing for anything useful, but it could be interesting.

EDIT: I meant google VLA, not veo 3

oooh; what are you imagining veo3 helping with? to my understanding it only generates video? found the paper i was thinking of: GitHub - NVlabs/FoundationStereo: [CVPR 2025 Best Paper Nomination] FoundationStereo: Zero-Shot Stereo Matching

That’s my bad lol, I wrote the wrong thing - I was using veo earlier for some b-roll and it was stuck in my head - I meant the google VLA models (paper). From what i’ve heard, nvidia should be coming out with a new-gen VLA model of their own in the next couple of months as well.

The paper you shared is pretty interesting though, but it might be hard to generalize to FRC robots with such a small sample size… especially given that they change so much year-to-year. perhaps some kind of fusion between the bumper detection and then you just use the stereo to obtain relative distance and combine with localization for global field coordinates?

I wonder if questNav could also be implemented.. the sensor suite could almost definitely be used for this… worth looking into more.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T06:19:19.152Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":226,"readers_count":225,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://deepmind.google/models/gemini-robotics/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Gemini Robotics - Google DeepMind","clicks":5},{"url":"https://arxiv.org/pdf/2503.20020","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63643,"username":"taciturnaxolotl","name":"kieran","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/taciturnaxolotl/{size}/240907_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63685,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9644 Captain + Driver"},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3689723,"name":"Geoffrey","username":"Geoffrey8814","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T07:22:45.853Z","cooked":"

We tried RL with occupancy grids and LLM guidance. However the result isn’t great, it can achieve basic scoring but fails to learn high-level strategies. We also tried model-based reinforcement learning but the results weren’t great either. Another problem we faced was the vision processing model, which used object detection and depth estimation wasn’t accurate and consistent enough for us. Currently, I am working on a transformer-based end-to-end model. I plan to use mapping and localization for pretraining the observation layers, imitation learning for pretraining the action layers, and reinforcement learning and adversarial environment for fine-tuning.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T07:30:23.331Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":206,"readers_count":205,"score":65.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"Geoffrey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60663,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3689726,"name":"","username":"w1zxrd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/w1zxrd/{size}/246745_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T08:47:51.091Z","cooked":"

That’s awesome, good to know… I just brainstormed a few ideas/suggestions, let me know if you want to expand on them later in your implementation.

I think probably the core of the RL being successful will be a multimodal sensor fusion strategy, combining pure vision (with object detection) with something that can physically understand depth (whether that’s LiDAR, Stereo Cameras, or the Quest 3 Depth API). I think this will filter out most of the noise and probably will need to rely on some type of self-supervised learning to align the features.

I think adding dense intermediate goals or shaped rewards could also help in optimizing the reward func for the policy… not 100% sure on this, have you tried it yet?

Also, are you planning on using some type of spatio-temporal architecture? I would guess that will also be critical for extracting motion patterns and predicting dynamics.

Question on the action layers - are you synthetically creating the data, or observing real matches/“playacting” them? I think log data might be best for this (though if occupancy grids failed, I’m not sure).

Another idea I have for the adversarial env. - maybe a shared critic combined with ABM for alliance members? Could help with the overall higher level strategy failure? Might be biting off too much at once though..

I’d be interested in seeing your previous implementations, if you can share? What you’re training on, processor that’s running the model, etc.? Really cool stuff that you’re working on though.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T08:48:07.064Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":48.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60663,"username":"Geoffrey8814","name":"Geoffrey","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63685,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9644 Captain + Driver"},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3689727,"name":"Geoffrey","username":"Geoffrey8814","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T09:13:47.230Z","cooked":"

Thanks, our goal is to let the model learn the strategies by itself rather than leveraging human guidance. I don’t have the latest results but here is a model trained using RL and occupancy grid with manual reward modeling for only a few hours.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T09:14:33.331Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":46.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"Geoffrey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H2LU96zHbGtFbMrA7j95i-AKS4i90Oyx/view?usp=drivesdk","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63685,"username":"w1zxrd","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/w1zxrd/{size}/246745_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60663,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3689728,"name":"Geoffrey","username":"Geoffrey8814","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T09:19:25.494Z","cooked":"

currently we are only training on synthetical data, cuz it’s really hard to extract mass amount of usefull information from match video. We haven’t implemented it on a processor yet, but we are probably going to use the Jetson Orin NX or the Mac Mini. The simulator that we are currently using is the mosimulator, but we are migrating to Isaac sim for better realism.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T12:58:30.045Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":91.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"Geoffrey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63685,"username":"w1zxrd","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/w1zxrd/{size}/246745_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60663,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3689774,"name":"kieran","username":"taciturnaxolotl","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/taciturnaxolotl/{size}/240907_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-25T12:53:49.210Z","cooked":"

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-25T12:53:49.210Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"kieran","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3691589,"name":"Sanjay Rajagopal","username":"Sneakyscarab","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-28T02:19:00.068Z","cooked":"

Just a few thoughts -

  • I would definitely take a MARL approach if the goal is to find high level strategies. Here’s a couple of interesting papers I have read which might be worth looking into for FRC use -

    [2412.17993] Multi-Agent Path Finding in Continuous Spaces with Projected Diffusion Models

    [1810.11187] TarMAC: Targeted Multi-Agent Communication

  • I wonder if transformer architecture is the right approach to this - training is going to be pretty inefficient and in the context of FRC I don’t really see major benefits to using a transformer architecture over a simpler and cheaper dot product attention(if even necessary) to process the observation for an algorithm like SAC - might be wrong on this though.

  • Would you need the RL to have a sensor with a physical understanding of depth to be successful? I would think that a CNN would be able to deal with the problem well enough.

  • @Geoffrey8814 Couple of questions - What RL algorithms have you tested so far - any that perform a lot better than the rest? What has your observation space been for your projects?

Using RL in robotics has been on my mind for a while recently - glad to see people taking a stab at it.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-28T02:19:00.068Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504626,"topic_slug":"external-robot-observation-for-navigation","display_username":"Sanjay Rajagopal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.17993","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"[2412.17993] Multi-Agent Path Finding in Continuous Spaces with Projected Diffusion Models","clicks":1},{"url":"https://arxiv.org/abs/1810.11187","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"[1810.11187] TarMAC: Targeted Multi-Agent Communication","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63257,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/external-robot-observation-for-navigation/504626/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3691658,"name":"Geoffrey","username":"Geoffrey8814","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-28T05:08:12.352Z","cooked":"

I don’t have the latest result but I think my friend who is working on the action layer told me that by tuning the learning rate, he was able to get a decent result using a simple LSTM. We chose a transformer because we found it tough to train a simple model to perform a high level of strategy. We were largely inspired by many end-to-end self-driving papers, the TEM-t paper, and many vision transformer models. We also chose synthetic data because of the amount of data needed for training a transformer. Additionally, by pre-training the transformer, it might accelerate the RL training at a high level of strategy because the model has already learned a basic understanding of the game and how things work.

I think if you are only going for a simple drive to a point with an object avoidance model. You should take a look at Zurich’s autonomous FPV and their robotic dog. They used a U-net for perception, and a LSTM for the action layer.
